prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She lived in Europe for a time, where she studied psychology.
Character 1
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: The head of our office. He was retired once, but made his return to the legal world a few months ago.
Character 2
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: The lawyer at my agency who was attacked during the court bombing trial. He's currently recovering at the hospital.
Character 3
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 4
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of mine.
Character 5
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. Talented singer and Student Council President, she is studying to be a judge.
Character 6
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 7
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He can manipulate witnesses through the power of suggestion.
Character 8
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 9
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 10
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 11
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 12
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 13
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 2
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 3
Name: Utility Knife
Description: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted. It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.
Evidence 4
Name: Bombing Report
Description: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.
Evidence 5
Name: Evacuation Report
Description: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.
Evidence 6
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access. Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)
Evidence 7
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 8
Name: Oxygen Tank Data
Description: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder. The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.
Evidence 9
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 10
Name: Bullet Hole
Description: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing. The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.
Evidence 11
Name: Control Room Door Lock
Description: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.
Evidence 12
Name: Bullet
Description: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.
Evidence 13
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.
Evidence 14
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 15
Name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
Description: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.
Evidence 16
Name: Lighter
Description: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood. Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Detective Arme and I rushed towards the boarding lounge together.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 1
Testimony: We went via the Control Room and peeked in from there to see what was going on inside.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 2
Testimony: We saw a figure standing in the middle of the lounge, and Terran lying on the floor.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 3
Testimony: I hate to say it, but I can only imagine the standing figure mast have been Starbuck.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 4
Testimony: Detective Arme fired two warning shots at the figure.
Person: Cosmos

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by understanding what we're dealing with.

First, I'll look at the characters. There's Athena Cykes, Phoenix Wright, Apollo Justice, and others. The victim is Clay Terran, and the defendant is Solomon Starbuck. The setting is a Space Center, which is an interesting and specific location. The case involves a stabbing and some bombings, which adds complexity.

Now, looking at the evidences, there are several items like the autopsy report, utility knife, security camera video, bullet holes, and more. The testimonies are from various individuals involved in the case, including the defendant and other witnesses.

My goal is to find one evidence and one testimony that contradict each other. To do this, I'll go through each testimony and see if any of the evidence directly contradicts what's being said.

Starting with Testimony 0: "Detective Arme and I rushed towards the boarding lounge together." This is from Yuri Cosmos. I'll check the evidence to see if there's anything that contradicts this. The Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows the defendant and victim escaping, but it doesn't mention Yuri or Detective Arme. However, the Evacuation Report (Evidence 5) mentions police officers and riot police giving evacuation instructions, which might support that they were present.

Moving to Testimony 1: "We went via the Control Room and peeked in from there to see what was going on inside." Again, I'll check if any evidence contradicts this. The Control Room Door Lock (Evidence 11) is only operable by the director, which is Yuri. If Yuri and Detective Arme went through the Control Room, this might align with the evidence, so no contradiction here.

Testimony 2: "We saw a figure standing in the middle of the lounge, and Terran lying on the floor." The autopsy report (Evidence 1) confirms Terran's death by stabbing, which aligns with seeing him lying on the floor. The Utility Knife (Evidence 3) is the murder weapon, which supports this testimony, so no contradiction.

Testimony 3: "I hate to say it, but I can only imagine the standing figure mast have been Starbuck." This points to the defendant, Solomon Starbuck. The Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows the defendant and victim escaping, which might support this. However, the testimony is more of an assumption, so I need to see if evidence directly contradicts this.

Testimony 4: "Detective Arme fired two warning shots at the figure." Now, looking at the evidence, the Bullet Hole (Evidence 10) was made by a .38-caliber gun, and the Bullet from Arme's Gun (Evidence 15) was fired from a .38 caliber. This seems to support the testimony. However, the Bullet (Evidence 12) was from a .10 caliber, which doesn't match. This discrepancy could be a contradiction.

Wait, let me clarify. If Detective Arme fired two warning shots from her .38 caliber gun, but Evidence 12 shows a bullet from a .10 caliber, that suggests that not all shots were from her gun. This could mean that someone else fired a shot, contradicting the testimony that only Detective Arme fired warning shots.

So, the testimony says Detective Arme fired two warning shots, but the evidence shows a bullet from a different caliber, indicating another shooter. This is a clear contradiction.

Therefore, the evidence that contradicts Testimony 4 is Evidence 12.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I've been given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a legal case. My task is to identify a pair consisting of one evidence and one testimony that contradict each other. I need to provide an explanation and then output the answer in a specific JSON format.

First, I'll start by understanding the context. The case involves a murder at a Space Center, with Solomon Starbuck as the defendant and Clay Terran as the victim. The evidence includes items like the victim's autopsy report, a utility knife with the victim's blood, a space center diagram, and more. The testimonies include statements from various individuals involved in the case.

I need to carefully go through each evidence and testimony to find contradictions. A contradiction would occur when the evidence clearly shows something that directly opposes what a testimony states, or vice versa.

Looking at the testimonies, I see that Yuri Cosmos, the director, testified about the events leading to the discovery of the body. He mentions rushing to the Control Room with Detective Arme, seeing a figure in the boarding lounge, and the figure firing at them. 

Now, looking at the evidence, there's a bullet hole found in the boarding lounge, which was made by a .38-caliber gun. There's also a bullet found in a gutter, fired from a .10 caliber handgun, and a bullet from Arme's gun, which is a .38 caliber.

The testimonies mention that Detective Arme fired two warning shots. However, the evidence shows that the bullet found matches a .38 caliber, which is the same as Arme's gun. This suggests that the shots fired by Arme could have caused the bullet hole and the bullet found.

But Yuri's testimony says they were fired at by the figure in the lounge, implying that the shots came from the figure, not from Arme. However, the evidence indicates that Arme's gun was used, which contradicts the testimony that the shots came from the figure in the lounge.

So, the contradiction is between the testimony claiming the figure fired at them and the evidence showing that the bullet was from Arme's gun, indicating she fired the shots, not the figure.

Thus, the evidence that contradicts the testimony is the bullet hole and the bullet from Arme's gun, and the testimony about the figure firing at them.
</think>
